reviews.sentence: Felt like I was camping. This is an old hotel that desperately needs renovation. The rooms are small and the beds are uncomfortable. There are no places to relax. There is a central cafeteria with hard chairs and tables kind of what you had see in a hospital. It was snowing and it would have been so great to have a fireplace or couches to sit and enjoy the snowfall. The upside location of this hotel is ideal for exploring the staff was helpful and it was relatively inexpensive. Xantera needs to put some money into remodeling this property and until they do I would not stay here again.

Sandi and Fred. The room was small and the carpet needed cleaning. Our only trouble was the sheets were not put on the bed correctly. They used a flat bottom sheet and it was left about a foot from the bottom of the bed. Making our feet be on the bare mattress. Gross. As soon as we found this problem we remade the bed as best as possible with flat sheets. We liked our location to the edge of the Canyon.

Acceptable acomodation. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived. Service at the receptionwas basic as the rooms are. Learning more about the area while our stay I believe its better to stay in Tusayan and go to the Rim for day hikes or other activities. Restaurants are better in Tusayan anyway.

Staying in the Village. Some signs of pestilence but did not see bugs. Noisy heater in room. We stayed in Spruce which had only 4 units on one floor and had a nice view to the forest. This lodge has no view of the canyon. The carpets are extremely dirty. There is a pizza pub and cafeteria close by that is convenient moderately priced and of moderate quality. I like staying in the village itself and the is the only space that is reasonably priced and available. I have stayed here twice and will do so again.

You pay for the location the room is like Motel 6. You pay for the location but the room is pretty basic. The bed was uncomfortable. No fitted sheet on the mattress so we would make contact with the mattress during the night as the sheet shifted around. The TV is one of those old big boxes. The picture quality was poor and dark. This is basically a 50 hotel room that you might pay 215 for. The room is a short walk to the rim. The canyon was amazing. The wifi is slow available in the lodge only and frustrating. The food in the Maswik eatery was pretty good.

Not worth the hype. This was the only option to stay inside the park on the days I was visiting I do not think it is worth the extra money to save on the driving into the park from town. Save the money and have a nice meal somewhere. The room was clean and everything worked fine. But there is no view of the Canyon from this lodge.

Maswik is a wonderful place to stay at the park. it is not a far walk from the Rim and while the rooms are more utilitarian than the El Tovar if you are there to experience the natural wonder of the canyon they are more than fine. The heater in the shower room was welcomed during the freezing nights. A standard room has two queen beds and is very affordable.
No Wifi in room was a bit of a negative but really close to everything you want in the village parking right outside room and if not then buses very close by.
Really good location and cafeteria. Very helpful staff. We were not in our room much and did not mind due to the proximity of trails but they are a little old.
Dated rooms on the south side with no internet service and far from restaurant food court. Not told about lack of WiFi in advance and can only have one device on WiFi at a time with password.
While the hotel itself is rather basic the rooms are clean and the staff was great. You can not beat staying just a few minutes walk from the rim of the canyon though.
Good location. The room is clean but old. Close to the restaurant.
Nice cozy room. Room was nice and cozy. Our room was on the second floor and had higher floor so it felt bigger. But if you have lots of luggage staying on the ground floor would be more convenient.
Next to Canyon and great views. Walked to bright trail canyon trail in 5 minutes.

We did not have high expectations for older hotels within the park but were very pleased. We were very happy we decided to stay in the park because of the convenience of being able to walk everywhere. The staff was so very friendly and amenities were available at very reasonable hours coffee shop opens at 530AM and gift shop closes at 10PM. It was extremely convenient to have a full cafeteria within walking distance of the room for my two kids and our conjoined rooms had mini fridges to store snacks. The rooms were clean and felt safe. We opted to pay a little more for a unit with AC. We parked right in front of our room and the vehicle was safe. The art on the walls and the lamp shades were all hand signed pieces that was a nice touch. Although we could not see the rim from our rooms we saw plenty of wildlife. We will definitely be going back.

The room was a pleasant surprise. Quaint is what my husband said. A bit small but plenty big enough for the two of us. We were lucky enough to get a ground unit and there is a small area to sit outside and watch the wildlife. both the two and four legged variety. I look forward to the evening outside looking at the stars by the visitors center.

Thank goodness for location. We stayed here for the location and probably still would again. But unfortunately it was dirty. dirty sock at the end of the bed hidden by the dust ruffle. in addition to large food crumbs fruit loops. The water was also not hot at all. Luke warm in the shower at best. In their defense they had just been hit with a storm and only had electricity for about 8 hours prior to our arrival our friends had no heat. no electric no food and no way to renter the room once they were manually let in. So there were clearly issues at work. The structure and decorations themselves felt rustic. although I do n’t believe it was intentional — I think they just have n’t updated anything for many many years unfortunately.
The elk came right outside are room.

One night stay. Stayed 1 night to breakup our dispersed car camping trip in January. Bed was comfortable the shower was clean and the heat worked. The room came with a balcony and a great view. The floorboards creaked a lot. We stayed on the second floor so it did not bother us but i can not imagine what someone on the first floor would hear. Front desk customer service was quick and friendly.

Bathroom was updated room and lenins were clean. Loved the picture window we could slide open with the forest right outside. Watched deer and birds from the window. Wish it had a microwave and better internet. The general store on property was amazing for gifts snacks or groceries with fair pricing and clean environment.
